newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar called to open little changed.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar called to open little changed.

text.p: CSCE world sugar was called to open mostly unchanged Friday, dealers said, with activity seen thin ahead of the Memorial Day holiday weekend.
Thursday, benchmark July settled down 0.09 cent at 11.06 cents a lb after trading from 11.21 to 10.94 cents. The outer months closed 0.05 and 0.02 lower.
An estimated 21,839 lots changed hands on the day.
Resistance was pegged at 11.20 cents for July, with firm support at 10.85 and then 10.70 cents.
LIFFE white sugar futures were little changed in extremely thin Friday trade, as many players remain in New York for Sugar Week activities.
